title: US Secret Service Director Quits Days After Shooting At Trump's Rally
content: US Secret Service Director Kimberly Cheatle has resigned, US media reported Tuesday, a day after she acknowledged that the agency failed in its mission to prevent the assassination attempt against Donald Trump.
summary: US Secret Service Director Kimberly Cheatle has resigned, US media reported Tuesday, a day after she acknowledged that the agency failed in its mission to prevent the assassination attempt against Donald Trump.

title: Bangladesh Student Group Leader Suspends Protests For 2 More Days
content: The leader of student demonstrations in Bangladesh that spiralled into widespread violence extended a suspension of protests for 48 more hours on Tuesday.
summary: The leader of student demonstrations in Bangladesh that spiralled into widespread violence extended a suspension of protests for 48 more hours on Tuesday.

title: Young Pilot Dies In Unexpected Crash Shortly After Skydivers Exit Aircraft
content: The crash occurred as Ms Georger was attempting to land the aircraft.

title: George Clooney Backs Kamala Harris, Hails Biden For "Saving Democracy"
content: Hollywood star George Clooney -- one of the first high-profile Democratic activists to urge Joe Biden not to seek reelection -- on Tuesday announced his backing for Kamala Harris, while hailing Biden's exit.
summary: Hollywood star George Clooney -- one of the first high-profile Democratic activists to urge Joe Biden not to seek reelection -- on Tuesday announced his backing for Kamala Harris, while hailing Biden's exit.

title: July 21 Was World's Hottest Day Ever Recorded: Report
content: July 21 was the hottest day ever recorded globally, according to preliminary data from the European Union's Copernicus Climate Change Service.
summary: July 21 was the hottest day ever recorded globally, according to preliminary data from the European Union's Copernicus Climate Change Service.

title: 5 Key Facts About Pete Buttigieg: Potential Running Mate for Kamala Harris
content: Pete Buttigieg, who earlier made history as the first openly gay Cabinet member, is being looked upon as the potential running mate for Kamala Harris.
summary: Pete Buttigieg, who earlier made history as the first openly gay Cabinet member, is being looked upon as the potential running mate for Kamala Harris.

title: Netanyahu Meets Families Of Israeli-American Hostages Held By Hamas In US
content: In what was his first meeting in the framework of the diplomatic visit to Washington, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu met with the families of the Israeli-American hostages held in the custody of Hamas, earlier on Tuesday, India time.
summary: In what was his first meeting in the framework of the diplomatic visit to Washington, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu met with the families of the Israeli-American hostages held in the custody of Hamas, earlier on Tuesday, India time.

title: WHO "Extremely Worried' At Prospect Of Polio, Other Outbreaks In Gaza
content: A top WHO official said Tuesday he was "extremely worried" over possible outbreaks in war-torn Gaza after poliovirus was detected in the sewage, warning that communicable diseases could cause more deaths than injuries.
summary: A top WHO official said Tuesday he was "extremely worried" over possible outbreaks in war-torn Gaza after poliovirus was detected in the sewage, warning that communicable diseases could cause more deaths than injuries.

title: Who Is Josh Shapiro, The Man Likely To Be Kamala Harris' Running Mate

title: "Hospice Care, Coup": Joe Biden's Absence Sparks Bizarre Theories
content: After Joe Biden dropped out of the 2024 US Presidential elections, social media has been abuzz with rumours that his health is deteriorating which is why he's been avoiding the public eye.
summary: After Joe Biden dropped out of the 2024 US Presidential elections, social media has been abuzz with rumours that his health is deteriorating which is why he's been avoiding the public eye.

title: Trump Says He Refused To Be Put On Stretcher After Shooting, Reveals Why
content: Former US President Donald Trump on Monday said he refused to use the stretcher after being injured in the shooting at his rally in Pennsylvania.
summary: Former US President Donald Trump on Monday said he refused to use the stretcher after being injured in the shooting at his rally in Pennsylvania.

title: Hamas Announces Deal With Palestinian Rivals For 'National Unity' In Beijing
content: Hamas announced Tuesday it had signed an agreement in Beijing with other Palestinian organisations including rivals Fatah to work together for "national unity", with China describing it as a deal to rule Gaza together once the war ends.
summary: Hamas announced Tuesday it had signed an agreement in Beijing with other Palestinian organisations including rivals Fatah to work together for "national unity", with China describing it as a deal to rule Gaza together once the war ends.

title: Violence Against Women In UK And Wales "A National Emergency": Police
content: Violence against women and girls in England and Wales is a "national emergency" with almost 3,000 offences recorded daily, police warned in a new report published on Tuesday.
summary: Violence against women and girls in England and Wales is a "national emergency" with almost 3,000 offences recorded daily, police warned in a new report published on Tuesday.

title: What Trump Said On Secret Service's Plan Ahead Of Assassination Attempt
content: Former US President Donald Trump narrowly escaped death when a 20-year-old shot a 5.56 mm bullet from an AR-15 rifle at a rally in Pennsylvania's Butler on July 13. Mr Trump was shot in the ear, with blood spattered on his face.
summary: Former US President Donald Trump narrowly escaped death when a 20-year-old shot a 5.56 mm bullet from an AR-15 rifle at a rally in Pennsylvania's Butler on July 13. Mr Trump was shot in the ear, with blood spattered on his face.

title: Donald Trump Reveals What Joe Biden Told Him After Assassination Attempt
content: Former US President Donald Trump, in a recent interview with Fox News, shared details of a phone call he had with President Joe Biden following the assassination attempt on him at an election campaign rally in Pennsylvania.
summary: Former US President Donald Trump, in a recent interview with Fox News, shared details of a phone call he had with President Joe Biden following the assassination attempt on him at an election campaign rally in Pennsylvania.

title: New "Vaccine-Like" HIV Drug Could Cost 1,000 Times Less Than Current Price
content: A new "vaccine-like" HIV drug that currently costs over $40,000 per person a year could be made for as little as $40, researchers estimated on Tuesday.
summary: A new "vaccine-like" HIV drug that currently costs over $40,000 per person a year could be made for as little as $40, researchers estimated on Tuesday.

title: Arrests Exceed Over 2500 Amid Unrest Over Employment Quotas In Bangladesh
content: The number of arrests in days of violence in Bangladesh passed the 2,500 mark in an AFP tally on Tuesday, after protests over employment quotas sparked widespread unrest.
summary: The number of arrests in days of violence in Bangladesh passed the 2,500 mark in an AFP tally on Tuesday, after protests over employment quotas sparked widespread unrest.

title: Tanzania President Fires Minister Over Comments Hinting At Poll Rigging
content: Tanzania President Samia Suluhu Hassan has fired two senior ministers, including the head of the foreign ministry, in a mini-cabinet reshuffle.
summary: Tanzania President Samia Suluhu Hassan has fired two senior ministers, including the head of the foreign ministry, in a mini-cabinet reshuffle.

title: 40,000 People On A Zoom Call: How $1.5 Million Was Raised For Kamala Harris
content: More than 44,000 people, led by black women, logged onto a Zoom call to support US Vice President Kamala Harris and raised more than $1.5 million for her campaign in three hours as she aims for the Oval Office in the west wing of the White House.
summary: More than 44,000 people, led by black women, logged onto a Zoom call to support US Vice President Kamala Harris and raised more than $1.5 million for her campaign in three hours as she aims for the Oval Office in the west wing of the White House.
